title: St Paul Healing the Cripple at Lystra
titles: Paul Healing the Cripple in Lystra
description: Paulus geneest de kreupele te Lystra. De apostel Paulus staat temidden van een groep om hulp of genezing vragende mensen. Hij maakt een gebaar in de richting van een kreupele man die zich links op de voorgrond bevindt. Op de achtergrond is, links in beeld, een zuil te zien van de tempel van Jupiter.

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of the Vereniging Rembrandt, with additional funding from the Prins Bernhard Fonds and the Rijksmuseum-Stichting

iconClassDescription: Paul and Barnabas heal a cripple; the people of Lystra think they are Mercury and Jupiter

longTitle: St Paul Healing the Cripple at Lystra, Karel du Jardin, 1663
subTitle: h 179cm × w 139cm × d 9cm

label.title: St Paul Healing the Cripple at Lystra
label.description:
Dujardin not only painted landscapes with Italian flair, but also large history paintings inspired by Italian
examples. Here, the Apostle Paul towers above a group of sick people. When he heals a crippled man in the
name of the Christian god, the onlookers take him to be the heathen god Mercury. Dujardin understood the
art of using figural gestures to enhance the pathos and drama of a scene.
